revisions.*:
'''Frank Wallace Notestein''' (August 16, 1902 – February 19, 1983) was an American [[demography|demographer]] who contributed significantly to the development of the science. He was the founding director of the [[Office of Population Research]] at [[Princeton University]], and later president of the [[Population Council]]. He was also the first director of the Population Division of the [[United Nations]], 1946–1948.<ref>Coale, Ansley J. (1983) Frank W. Notestein, 1902-1983 ''Population Index'' , Vol. 49, No. 1, Spring, 1983, pp. 3-12</ref><ref>Ryder, N. B. (1984). Obituary: Frank Wallace Notestein (1902-1983). ''Population Studies: a Journal of Demography'', 38, 1, March, 5-20.</ref>
